intro: Catunaregam torulosa, commonly known as the woolly catunaregam, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
